ai-pli-tv-kd4:0.3_0: The chapter on the invitation procedure
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.1.2_0: At that time in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country a number of monks who were friends had entered rainy-season residence together.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.1.4_0: “How can we remain united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.2.3_0: Whoever returns first from almsround in the village should prepare the seats and set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should clean the bowl for leftovers and set it out, and put out water for drinking and water for washing.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.3.1_0: Whoever returns last from almsround may eat whatever is leftover, or he should discard it where there are no cultivated plants or in water without life.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.3.2_0: He should put away the seats and also the foot-stool, the foot-scraper, and the water for washing the feet. He should clean the bowl for leftovers and put it away, put away the water for drinking and the water for washing, and sweep the dining hall.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.4.1_0: Whoever sees that the pot for drinking water, the pot for washing water, or the waterpot in the restroom is empty should fill it.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.4.2_0: If he can’t do it by himself, he should call someone over by hand signal and they should fill it together.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.4.3_0: He should not speak because of that.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.4.4_0: In this way we’ll remain united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.5.2_0: “Whoever returns first from almsround in the village should prepare the seats and set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should clean the bowl for leftovers and set it out, and put out water for drinking and water for washing.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.6.1_0: If there’s anything left over, whoever returns last eats it if they like. Otherwise they throw it out where there is little that grows, or drop it into water that has no living creatures.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.6.2_0: He puts away the seats and also the foot-stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet. He cleans the bowl for leftovers and puts it away, puts away the water for drinking and the water for washing, and sweeps the dining hall.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.7.1_0: Whoever sees that the pot for drinking water, the pot for washing water, or the waterpot in the restroom is empty fills it.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.7.2_0: If he can’t do it by himself, he should call someone over by hand signal and they should fill it together. He should not speak because of that.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.8.1_0: But now I’ve completed the rainy-season residence to go to see the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.8.2_0: So when they had completed the rains residence and the three months had elapsed, those monks put their dwellings in order, took their bowls and robes, and left for Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.8.3_0: When they eventually arrived at Sāvatthī, they went to the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. There they approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.8.4_0: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks, it is the newly arrived monks of the Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.9.2_0: “I hope you’re keeping well, monks, I hope you’re comfortable.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.9.3_0: I hope you’re united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.9.5_0: we’ve had a comfortable rains residence, in concord and harmony, without dispute, and we had no trouble getting almsfood.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.10.1_0: When Buddhas know what is going on, sometimes they ask and sometimes not; they know the right time to ask and the right time not to ask.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.10.2_0: When they know the right time, they ask about it.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.10.3_0: Buddhas ask when it is beneficial, not when it is unbeneficial,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.10.4_0: for Buddhas are incapable of doing what is unbeneficial.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.10.5_0: Buddhas question the monks for two reasons: to give a teaching or to lay down a training rule.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.10.6_0: And the Buddha said to those monks, “In what way, monks, did you have a comfortable rains residence, without having any trouble getting almsfood?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.1_0: “Sir, we’ve entered a number of monks who were friends through the Kosalan country in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.3_0: ‘How can we remain united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.6_0: Whoever returns first from almsround in the village should prepare the seats and set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should clean the bowl for leftovers and set it out, and put out water for drinking and water for washing.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.7_0: Whoever returns last from almsround may eat whatever is leftover, or he should discard it where there are no cultivated plants or in water without life.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.8_0: He should put away the seats and also the foot-stool, the foot-scraper, and the water for washing the feet. He should clean the bowl for leftovers and put it away, put away the water for drinking and the water for washing, and sweep the dining hall.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.9_0: Whoever sees that the pot for drinking water, the pot for washing water, or the waterpot in the restroom is empty should fill it.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.10_0: If he can’t do it by himself, he should call someone over by hand signal and they should fill it together.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.11_0: He should not speak because of that.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.12_0: In this way we’ll remain united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.13_0: And we didn’t talk too much.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.14_0: “Whoever returns first from almsround in the village should prepare the seats and set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should clean the bowl for leftovers and set it out, and put out water for drinking and water for washing.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.15_0: If there’s anything left over, whoever returns last eats it if they like. Otherwise they throw it out where there is little that grows, and puts it away with water for drinking and water for washing, and sweep the dining hall.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.16_0: Whoever sees that the pot for drinking water, the pot for washing water, or the waterpot in the restroom is empty fills it.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.17_0: If he can’t do it by himself, he should call someone over by hand signal and they should fill it together. He should not speak because of that.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.18_0: “That’s how we’re united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.12.1_0: When the message had been delivered, the Buddha said to the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.12.2_0: “While they dwelt in discomfort these foolish men claim they were dwelling in comfort.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.12.3_0: While they dwelt together like sheep, they claim they were dwelling in comfort.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.12.4_0: While they dwelt together like sheep, they claim they were dwelling in comfort.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.12.5_0: While they dwelt together like enemies, they claim they were dwelling in comfort.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.12.6_0: How can these foolish men take a vow of silence, as do the ascetics of other religions?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.1_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.2_0: after criticizing them, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.3_0: “You should not take a vow of silence, as do the ascetics of other religions.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.4_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.5_0: When you have completed the rainy-season residence, you should invite the monks to correct you in regard to three things:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.6_0: what has been seen, what has been heard, or what is suspected.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.7_0: This will help you live with one another in the proper way, help you clear yourself of offenses, and help you give priority to the training.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.1_0: And it should be done like this:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.2_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.3_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.6_0: The most senior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.7_0: ʻI invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.8_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.9_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.10_0: For the second time, I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.11_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.12_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.13_0: For the third time, I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.14_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.15_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.16_0: A junior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.17_0: ʻI invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.18_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.19_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.20_0: For the second time I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect. Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion. If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.21_0: For the third time I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.22_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.23_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.1_0: Soon afterwards the monks from the group of six remained seated while the senior monks were inviting correction, squatting on their heels.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.2_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.3_0: “How can the monks from the group of six act like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.4_0: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six were acting like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.8_0: “... How can those foolish men remain seated while the senior monks are inviting correction, squatting on their heels?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.9_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it or increase the confidence of those who have it ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.11_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.12_0: “You should not remain seated while the senior monks are inviting correction, squatting on their heels.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.13_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.14_0: Everyone should squat on their heels during the invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.2.1_0: On one occasion, while squatting on his heels and waiting for everyone to invite correction, a senior monk who was weak from old age fainted and fell over.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.2.2_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.2.3_0: “I allow you to squat on your heels and raise your joined palms to do the invitation procedure after sitting on the seat.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.1.3_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.1.6_0: These are the two invitation days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.3_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.5_0: The invitation procedure that is illegitimate and has an incomplete assembly;
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.6_0: The invitation procedure that is illegitimate but has a complete assembly;
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.7_0: The invitation procedure that is legitimate but has an incomplete assembly;
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.8_0: The invitation procedure that is legitimate and has a complete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.13_0: and third of these should not be done;
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.16_0: I have allowed such a procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.17_0: Therefore, monks, you should train like this: ʻWe will do invitation procedures that are legitimate and have a complete assembly.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.0_0: The allowance to pass on the invitation
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.1_0: When the message had been delivered, the Buddha said to the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.3_0: for the Sangha to invite correction.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.4_0: A certain monk who had done so told the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.5_0: “Venerable Sir, there’s a sick monk. He hasn’t come.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.6_0: “I allow a sick monk to pass on his invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.7_0: And it should be given like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.8_0: The sick monk should approach a single monk, put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.9_0: ʻI pass on my invitation; please convey my invitation; please announce my invitation; please invite correction on my behalf.’ If he makes this understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the invitation has been passed on.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.10_0: If he doesn’t make this understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the invitation hasn’t been passed on.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.1_0: If the other goes, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.2_0: If not, then the sick monk should be brought into the midst of the Sangha together with his bed or bench. They can then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.3_0: But if the one who is nursing the sick monk says,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.4_0: ʻIf we move him, his illness will get worse, or he’ll die,’ then the sick monk shouldn’t be moved.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.5_0: The Sangha should go to where the sick monk is and do the invitation procedure there.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.6_0: But you should not do the invitation procedure with an incomplete Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.7_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.1_0: “If, after the invitation has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the invitation departs right there, then the invitation should be passed on to another.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.2_0: If, after the invitation has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the invitation disrobes right there,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.3_0: dies when the time passes away,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.5_0: admits right there that he has renounced the training,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.6_0: admits to having committed the worst kind of offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.7_0: admits right there that he is insane,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.8_0: admits right there that he is deranged,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.9_0: admits to being overwhelmed by pain,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.10_0: admits to having been suspended for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.11_0: admits right there that he has been ejected for not making amends for an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.12_0: admits right there that he has been ejected for not giving up a bad view,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.14_0: admits to being a living in the community by theft,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.15_0: admits to previously having left to join the ascetics of another religion,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.17_0: admits right there that he has a matricide,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.19_0: admits to being a murderer of a perfected one,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.20_0: admits right there that he has raped a nun ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.21_0: admits to having caused a schism in the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.22_0: admits to having caused the Buddha to bleed,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.23_0: or admits right there that he’s a hermaphrodite, then the invitation should be passed on to another.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.24_0: If, after the invitation has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the invitation departs while on his way to the invitation procedure, then the invitation hasn’t been brought.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.25_0: If, after the invitation has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the invitation disrobes,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.26_0: dies when the time passes away,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.28_0: admits right there that he has renounced the training,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.29_0: admits to having committed the worst kind of offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.30_0: admits right there that he is insane,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.31_0: admits right there that he is deranged,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.32_0: admits to being overwhelmed by pain,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.33_0: admits to having been suspended for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.34_0: admits right there that he has been ejected for not making amends for an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.35_0: admits right there that he has been ejected for not giving up a bad view,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.37_0: admits to being a living in the community by theft,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.38_0: admits to previously having left to join the ascetics of another religion,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.40_0: admits right there that he has a matricide,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.42_0: admits to being a murderer of a perfected one,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.43_0: admits right there that he has raped a nun ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.44_0: admits to having caused a schism in the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.45_0: admits to having caused the Buddha to bleed,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.46_0: or admits that he’s a hermaphrodite while on his way to the invitation procedure, then the invitation hasn’t been brought.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.47_0: “But even if, after the invitation has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the invitation departs after reaching the Sangha, then the invitation has been brought.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.48_0: And even if, after the invitation has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the invitation disrobes,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.49_0: dies when the time passes away,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.51_0: admits right there that he has renounced the training,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.52_0: admits to having committed the worst kind of offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.53_0: admits right there that he is insane,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.54_0: admits right there that he is deranged,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.55_0: admits to being overwhelmed by pain,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.56_0: admits to having been suspended for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.57_0: admits right there that he has been ejected for not making amends for an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.58_0: admits right there that he has been ejected for not giving up a bad view,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.60_0: admits to being a living in the community by theft,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.61_0: admits to previously having left to join the ascetics of another religion,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.63_0: admits right there that he has a matricide,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.65_0: admits to being a murderer of a perfected one,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.66_0: admits right there that he has raped a nun ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.67_0: admits to having caused a schism in the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.68_0: admits to having caused the Buddha to bleed,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.69_0: or admits that he’s a hermaphrodite after reaching the Sangha, then the invitation has been brought.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.70_0: And even if, after the invitation has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the invitation reaches the Sangha, but doesn’t announce the invitation because he falls asleep, then the invitation has been brought.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.71_0: And there’s no offense for the one who is conveying the invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.72_0: And even if, after the invitation has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the invitation reaches the Sangha, but doesn’t announce the invitation because he is heedless
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.73_0: or because he gains a meditation attainment, then the invitation has been brought.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.74_0: And there’s no offense for the one who is conveying the invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.75_0: “And even if, after the invitation has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the invitation reaches the Sangha, but deliberately doesn’t announce the invitation, then the invitation has been brought.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.76_0: But there’s an offense of wrong conduct for the one who is conveying the invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.77_0: On the invitation day, if the Sangha has business to be done, then anyone passing on his invitation should also give his consent.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.1.0_0: Discussion of being seized by relatives, etc.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.1.1_0: At one time on the invitation day a certain monk was seized by his relatives.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.1.2_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.1.3_0: “If on the invitation day a monk is seized by his relatives,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.1.4_0: The monks should correct those monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.1.5_0: ‘Now, Venerables, let this monk invite you to ask for a moment while I invite the monk to ask you.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.1_0: If the other goes, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.2_0: If not, then those monks should correct those monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.3_0: ‘Now, Venerables, please go to one side for a moment while this monk is saying.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.4_0: If the other goes, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.5_0: If not, then those monks should correct those monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.6_0: ‘Now, Venerables, please do the invitation procedure until the Sangha invites me to correction.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.7_0: If the other goes, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.8_0: If not, you should do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.9_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.1_0: If on the invitation day a monk is seized by kings,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.5_0: other monks should say to those enemies,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.6_0: ‘Now, Venerables, let this monk invite you to ask for a moment while I invite the monk to ask you.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.7_0: If the other goes, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.8_0: If not, then those monks should correct those enemies like this:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.9_0: ‘Now, Venerables, please go to one side for a moment while this monk is saying.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.10_0: If the other goes, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.11_0: If not, then those monks should correct those enemies like this:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.12_0: ‘Now, Venerables, please do the invitation procedure until the Sangha invites me to correction.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.13_0: If the other goes, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.14_0: If not, you should do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.15_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.1.0_0: Various kinds of invitation ceremonies for the Sangha, etc.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.1.1_0: At one time on the invitation day there were five monks staying in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.1.3_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having an extra robe, he thought,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.1.4_0: that the invitation procedure should be done with a sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.1.6_0: How should we do the invitation procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.1.7_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.1.8_0: “When there are five of you, you should do the invitation procedure in the Sangha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.2.1_0: At one time on the invitation day there were four monks staying in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.2.3_0: “The Buddha has instructed that the invitation procedure should be done in the Sangha when there are five monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.2.4_0: But there’s only four of us.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.2.5_0: How should we do the invitation procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.2.6_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.2.7_0: “When there are four of you, you should do the invitation procedure with one another.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.1_0: And it should be done like this:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.2_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform those monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.3_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask you to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the venerables, we should do the invitation procedure with one another.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.6_0: The most senior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to those monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.7_0: ʻI invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.8_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.9_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.11_0: For the third time, I invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.12_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.13_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.14_0: A junior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.15_0: ʻI invite the you correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.16_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.17_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.19_0: For the third time I invite the you correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.20_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.21_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.1_0: At one time on the invitation day there were three monks staying in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.3_0: “The Buddha has instructed that the invitation procedure should be done in the Sangha when there are five monks and with one another when there are four.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.4_0: But there’s only three of us.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.5_0: How should we do the invitation procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.6_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.7_0: “When there are three of you, you should do the invitation procedure with one another.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.8_0: And it should be done like this:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.9_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform those monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.10_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask you to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.12_0: If it seems appropriate to the venerables, we should do the invitation procedure with one another.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.13_0: The most senior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to those monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.14_0: ʻI invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.16_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.18_0: For the third time, I invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.20_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.21_0: A junior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.22_0: ʻI invite the you correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.24_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.26_0: For the third time I invite the you correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.28_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.5.1_0: At one time on the invitation day there were two monks staying in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.5.3_0: “The Buddha has instructed that the invitation procedure should be done in the Sangha when there are five monks and with one another when there are three or four.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.5.4_0: But there’s only two of us.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.5.5_0: How should we do the invitation procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.5.6_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.5.7_0: “When there are two of you, you should do the invitation procedure with each other.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.1_0: And it should be done like this:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.2_0: The most senior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the junior monk:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.3_0: ʻI invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.4_0: Please correct me, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.5_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.7_0: For the third time, I invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.8_0: Please correct me, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.9_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.10_0: A junior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.11_0: ʻI invite the venerable to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.12_0: Please correct me, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.13_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.15_0: For the third time I invite the venerable to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.16_0: Please correct me, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.17_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.7.1_0: At one time on the invitation day a monk was staying in a certain monastery by himself.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.7.3_0: “The Buddha has instructed that the invitation procedure should be done in the Sangha when there are five monks and with one another when there are two, three, or four.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.7.5_0: How should I do the invitation procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.7.6_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.8.1_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that a monk is staying by himself in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.8.2_0: That monk should sweep whatever place the monks normally go to: whether the assembly hall, under a roof-cover, or at the foot of a tree. He should set out water for drinking and water for washing, should prepare a seat, light a lamp, and sit down.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.8.3_0: If other monks come, he should do the invitation procedure with them.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.8.4_0: If not, he should determine: ʻToday is my invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.8.5_0: If he doesn’t make a determination, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.1_0: Wherever five monks are staying together, four shouldn’t do the invitation procedure in the Sangha while bringing the invitation of one.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.2_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.3_0: Wherever four monks are staying together, three shouldn’t do the invitation procedure with one another while bringing the invitation of one.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.4_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.5_0: Wherever three monks are staying together, two shouldn’t do the invitation procedure with each other while bringing the invitation of one.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.6_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.7_0: Wherever two monks are staying together, one shouldn’t make a determination while bringing the invitation of one.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.8_0: If you make a determination in this way, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.0_0: The process for making amends for an offense
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.1_0: At one time on the invitation day a certain monk had committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.3_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having an extra robe, he thought,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.4_0: that the invitation procedure shouldn’t be done with a group.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.6_0: So what should I do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.7_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.8_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that a monk has committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.9_0: That monk should approach a single monk, put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.10_0: ʻI have committed such-and-such an offense. I confess it.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.15_0: On the invitation day it may happen that a monk is unsure if he’s committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.16_0: That monk should approach a single monk, put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.17_0: ‘I’m unsure if I’ve committed such-and-such an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.18_0: I’ll make amends for it when I’m sure.’ They can then continue the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.19_0: You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.0_0: The process for revealing an offense
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.1_0: At one time a certain monk remembered an offense during the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.3_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having an extra robe, he thought,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.4_0: that the invitation procedure shouldn’t be done with a group.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.6_0: So what should I do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.7_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.8_0: “It may happen that a monk remembers an offense during the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.11_0: Once this meeting is finished, I’ll make amends for it.’ They can then continue the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.12_0: You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.1_0: It may happen during the invitation procedure that a monk becomes unsure if he’s committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.3_0: ‘I’m unsure if I’ve committed such-and-such an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.4_0: I’ll make amends for it when I’m sure.’ They can then continue the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.5_0: You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.6.0_0: The process for making amends for a shared offense
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.6.1_0: At one time on the invitation day the whole sangha in a certain monastery had committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.8_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having an extra robe, he thought,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.9_0: ‘Nothing should not be received, nor shared offenses.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.10_0: and this whole sangha has committed it.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.11_0: So what should we do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.12_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.13_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that the whole sangha in a certain monastery has committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.14_0: they should straightaway send one monk to a neighboring monastery
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.15_0: ʻGo and make amends for this offense. When you return, we’ll make amends for it in your presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.16_0: If the other goes, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.17_0: If not, then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.18_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.19_0: but this whole sangha has committed it.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.20_0: When the Sangha sees another monk who is pure and free from offenses, it should make amends for this offense in his presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.21_0: Once this has been said, they can do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.22_0: You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.23_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that the whole sangha in a certain monastery is unsure if it has committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.24_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.25_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.26_0: but this whole sangha was unsure of it.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.27_0: When the Sangha is sure, it should make amends for this offense.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.28_0: Once this has been said, they can do the invitation procedure. You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.29_0: The first section for recitation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.1.0_0: The group of fifteen on non-offenses
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.1.1_0: At one time on the invitation day five or more resident monks had gathered in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.1.3_0: that there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.1.4_0: Perceiving that they were acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly was complete although it was not, they did the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.1.5_0: During the procedure a greater number of resident monks arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.1.6_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.2.1_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that five or more resident monks have gathered in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.2.3_0: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.2.4_0: Perceiving that they were acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly was complete although it was not, they did the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.2.5_0: During the procedure, a greater number of resident monks arrive.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.2.6_0: In such a case, those monks should do the invitation procedure once more.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.2.7_0: And there’s no offense for those who already have invited.”

ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.3_0: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.5_0: During the procedure, a greater number of resident monks arrive.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.6_0: or the invitation procedure has been brought to those who have already been invited.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.7_0: And there’s no offense for those who already have invited.”

ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.10_0: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.11_0: Perceiving that they were acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly was complete although it was not, they did the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.12_0: During the procedure, a smaller number of resident monks arrive.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.13_0: or the invitation procedure has been brought to those who have already been invited.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.14_0: And there’s no offense for those who already have invited.”

ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.3_0: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.4_0: Perceiving that they were acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly was complete although it was not, they did the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.5_0: When they’ve just finished, a greater number of resident monks arrive.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.6_0: In such a case, those monks should do the invitation procedure once more.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.7_0: And there’s no offense for those who already have invited.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.8_0: “It may happen on the invitation day five or more resident monks have gathered in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.10_0: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.11_0: Perceiving that they were acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly was complete although it was not, they did the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.12_0: When they’ve just finished, an equal number of resident monks arrive.

ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.14_0: And there’s no offense for those who already have invited.”

ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.1_0: “It may happen that for the resident monks it’s the fourteenth day of the lunar half-month, but for the newly arrived monks it’s the fifteenth. Then—
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.2_0: If the number of resident monks is greater, the newly arrived monks should fall in line with resident monks.

ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.20.1_0: “It may happen that newly arrived monks see signs and indications of resident monks: beds and bench have been made up, water for drinking and water for washing have been put out, precincts are well-swept.

ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.48.1_0: “It may happen that newly arrived monks see in a resident monks with resident monks.

ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.0_0: invitation procedure by means of two statements
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.1_0: At one time on the invitation day in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country there was danger from aboriginals.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.2_0: The monks were not able to do the invitation procedure by means of three statements.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.3_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.4_0: “I allow you to do the invitation procedure by means of two statements.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.5_0: The danger from aboriginals increased further.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.6_0: The monks were not able to do the invitation procedure by means of two statements.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.7_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.8_0: “I allow you to do the invitation procedure by means of one statement.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.9_0: The danger from aboriginals increased further.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.10_0: The monks were not able to do the invitation procedure by means of one statement.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.11_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.12_0: “I allow you to do the invitation procedure in groups according to year of seniority.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.2.1_0: On one occasion on the invitation day in a certain monastery, most of the night was used up by people making offerings.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.2.3_0: “Most of the night has been used up by offerings.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.2.4_0: and thought, “If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, we won’t be finished before dawn.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.2.5_0: So what should we do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.2.6_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.3_0: ‘This is the most of the night when offerings.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.4_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.5_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.6_0: Most of the night has been used up by people making offerings.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.7_0: and thought, “If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, we won’t be finished before dawn.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.8_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure by means of two statements.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day in a certain monastery that most of the night is used up by monks giving teachings,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.2_0: by experts on the discourses reciting discourses together,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.3_0: by experts on the Monastic Law deliberating on the Monastic Law together,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.4_0: by expounders of the Teaching discussing the Teaching,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.7_0: ‘I’m going by monks arguing with the good people, by exhausting.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.8_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.9_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.10_0: Most of the night has been used up by monks arguing.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.11_0: and thought, “If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, we won’t be finished before dawn.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.12_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure by means of two statements.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.5.1_0: At one time on the invitation day in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country a large sangha of monks had gathered. A storm was approaching, but they only had a small area that was sheltered.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.5.3_0: “This large Sangha of monks has gathered. A storm is approaching, but we only have a small area that’s sheltered.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.5.4_0: and thought, “If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, we won’t be finished before it starts raining.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.5.5_0: So what should we do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.5.6_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.3_0: ‘This large Sangha of monks has gathered. A storm is approaching, but we only have a small area that’s sheltered.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.4_0: and thought, “If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, we won’t be finished before it starts raining.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.5_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.6_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.7_0: This large Sangha of monks has gathered. A storm is approaching, but we only have a small area that’s sheltered.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.8_0: and thought, “If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, we won’t be finished before it starts raining.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.9_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure by means of two statements.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day in a certain monastery that there is danger from kings,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.10_0: or a danger to living the spiritual life.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.12_0: ‘This is a danger to living the spiritual life.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.13_0: and think, ‘This is a danger to living the spiritual life. If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, we won’t be finished before the danger manifests,’ then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.14_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.15_0: This is a danger to living the spiritual life.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.16_0: If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, it will not be finished before the danger manifests.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.17_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure by means of two statements.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.1.1_0: At that time the monks from the group of six invited correction while having uncleared offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.1.2_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.1.3_0: “You should not invite correction if you have uncleared offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.1.4_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.1.5_0: If anyone invites correction with uncleared offenses, you should get their permission and then accuse them of an offense.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.1_0: Soon afterwards, when asked for permission to be corrected, the monks from the group of six did not wish to give it.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.2_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.3_0: “If anyone doesn’t give their permission to be corrected, you should cancel their invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.4_0: And it should be canceled like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.5_0: On the invitation day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, in the middle of the Sangha and in the presence of that person, you should announce:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.6_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.7_0: Such-and-such a person has uncleared offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.9_0: He shouldn’t do the invitation procedure in the presence of the monks.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.10_0: Their invitation has then been canceled.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.1_0: When the monks from the group of six knew that
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.2_0: thinking to act before the good monks canceled their invitation,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.3_0: but having no grounds or reasons—canceled the invitation of pure monks who had not committed any offenses. They also canceled the invitation of those who already had invited.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.4_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.5_0: “You should not, without reason, cancel the invitation of pure monks who don’t have any offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.6_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.7_0: And you should not cancel the invitation of those who already have invited.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.8_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.1_0: “And this is how the invitation is canceled and how it isn’t canceled.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.2_0: And how is there eight invitation?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.3_0: If the invitation is canceled after a three-statement invitation has been spoken and concluded, then it’s not canceled.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.4_0: If the invitation is canceled when a two-statement invitation ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.6_0: after an invitation done in groups according to the year of seniority has been spoken and concluded, then it’s not canceled.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.7_0: “And this is how there are eight invitations.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.8_0: “And how is the invitation procedure canceled?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.5.1_0: If the invitation is canceled when a three-statement invitation hasn’t yet been concluded, then it’s canceled.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.5.2_0: If the invitation is canceled when a two-statement invitation ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.5.4_0: when an invitation done in groups according to the year of seniority hasn’t yet been concluded, then it’s canceled.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.5.5_0: “And this is how the invitation is canceled.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.6.1_0: On the invitation day it may happen that a monk cancels his invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.6.2_0: other monks know that he has seen him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.6.3_0: ‘This venerable is impure in bodily conduct, verbal conduct, and livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent, incapable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should press him by saying, ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ and the Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.7.1_0: On the invitation day it may happen that a monk cancels his invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.7.2_0: other monks know that he has seen him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.7.3_0: ‘This venerable is pure in bodily conduct, but impure in verbal conduct and livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent, incapable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should press him by saying, ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ and the Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.8.1_0: On the invitation day it may happen that a monk cancels his invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.8.2_0: other monks know that he has seen him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.8.3_0: ‘This venerable is pure in bodily conduct and verbal conduct, but impure in livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent, incapable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should press him by saying, ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ and the Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.9.1_0: On the invitation day it may happen that a monk cancels his invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.9.2_0: other monks know that he has seen him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.9.3_0: ‘This venerable is pure in bodily conduct, verbal conduct, and livelihood; but he’s ignorant and incompetent, incapable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should press him by saying, ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ and the Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.10.1_0: On the invitation day it may happen that a monk cancels his invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.10.2_0: other monks know that he has seen him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.10.3_0: ‘This venerable is pure in bodily conduct, verbal conduct, and livelihood; and he’s knowledgeable and competent, capable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should say to him, ‘Are you canceling this monk’s invitation because he has failed in morality, in conduct, or in view?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.11.2_0: ‘I’m canceling it because he has failed in morality’, ‘I’m canceling it because he has failed in conduct’, ‘I’m canceling it because he has failed in view,’ he should be asked,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.11.3_0: ‘Do you know what failure in morality is?’ ‘do you know what failure in conduct is?’ ‘do you know what failure in view is?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.11.5_0: ‘I do,’ he should be asked what they are.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.11.6_0: ‘But what is failure in morality? What is their failure in conduct? What is that failure in view?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.12.2_0: ‘The four offenses entailing expulsion and the thirteen entailing suspension are failure in morality,’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.12.3_0: ‘The serious offenses, the offenses entailing confession, the offenses entailing acknowledgment, the offenses of wrong conduct, and the offenses of wrong speech are failure in conduct,’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.12.4_0: ‘Wrong views and side views are failure in view,’ he should be asked,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.12.5_0: ‘Are you canceling this monk’s invitation because of what you have seen, because of what you have heard, or because of suspicion?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.13.2_0: ‘I’m canceling it because of what I have seen’, ‘I’m canceling it because of what I have heard’, ‘I’m canceling it because of suspicion,’ he should be asked,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.13.3_0: ‘Since you’re canceling this monk’s invitation because of what you have seen, what have you seen? How did you see it? When did you see it? Where did you see it? Did you see him commit an offense entailing expulsion? Did you see him commit an offense entailing suspension?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.13.7_0: but an offense of wrong conduct ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.13.8_0: ... an offense of wrong speech? Where were you? Where was this monk? What were you doing? What was this monk doing?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.14.2_0: ‘I didn’t cancel this monk’s invitation because of what I have seen, but because of what I have heard,’ he should be asked,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.14.3_0: ‘Since you’re canceling this monk’s invitation because of what you have heard, what have you heard? How did you hear it? When did you hear it? Where did you hear it?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.14.4_0: heard that he has committed an offense entailing expulsion, but he regards it as a serious offense ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.14.4_2: but an offense of wrong conduct ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.14.4_3: They’ve committed an offense of wrong speech.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.14.5_0: Did you hear it from a monk? Did you hear it from a nun? Did you hear it from a trainee nun? Did you hear it from a novice monk? Did you hear it from a novice nun? Did you hear it from a male lay follower? Did you hear it from a female lay follower? Did you hear it from kings? Did you hear it from a king’s officials? Did you hear it from the ascetics of another religion? Did you hear it from the lay followers of another religion?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.15.1_0: If he says, ‘I didn’t cancel this monk’s invitation because of what I have heard, but because of suspicion,’ he should be asked,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.15.2_0: ‘Since you’re canceling this monk’s invitation because of suspicion, what do you suspect? How do you suspect it? When did you suspect it? Where did you suspect it?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.15.3_0: Do you suspect that he has committed an offense entailing expulsion? Do you suspect that he has committed an offense entailing suspension?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.15.3_3: but an offense of wrong conduct ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.15.3_4: I’ve committed an offense of wrong speech,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.15.4_0: Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a monk? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a nun? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a trainee nun? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a novice monk? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a novice nun? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a male lay follower? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a female lay follower? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from kings? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a king’s officials? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from the ascetics of another religion? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from the lay followers of another religion?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.16.2_0: ‘I didn’t cancel this monk’s invitation because of suspicion. I don’t know on what basis I canceled his invitation.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.16.3_0: “If the accusing monk, when questioned, isn’t able to satisfy his discerning fellow monastics, they should conclude, ‘The accused monk is improperly accused.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.16.4_0: But if the accusing monk, when questioned, is able to satisfy his discerning fellow monastics, they should conclude, ‘The accused monk is properly accused.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.17.1_0: If the accusing monk admits to a groundless charge of an offense entailing expulsion, he should be charged with that offense. The Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.17.2_0: If the accusing monk admits to a groundless charge of an offense entailing suspension, he should be dealt with according to the rule. The Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.17.3_0: If the accusing monk admits to a groundless charge of a serious offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.17.7_0: or an offense of wrong speech, he should be dealt with according to the rule. The Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.18.1_0: If the accused monk admits to having committed an offense entailing expulsion, he should be expelled. The Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.18.2_0: If the accused monk admits to having committed an offense entailing suspension, he should be charged with that offense. The Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.18.3_0: If the accused monk admits to having committed a serious offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.18.6_0: but an offense of wrong conduct ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.18.7_0: or an offense of wrong speech, he should be dealt with according to the rule. The Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.19.0_0: Grounds for a serious offense, etc.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.19.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk has committed a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.19.2_0: Some monks regard it as a serious offense, but others as an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.19.3_0: Those monks who have committed a serious offense, but then they should approach the Sangha and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.19.4_0: ‘The mendicant who has committed an offense should deal with it properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.19.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk has committed a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.2_0: Some monks regard it as a serious offense, but others as an offense entailing confession ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.3_0: Some monks regard it as a serious offense, but others as an offense entailing acknowledgment ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.4_0: Some monks regard it as a serious offense, but others as an offense of wrong conduct ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.5_0: Some monks regard it as a serious offense, but others as an offense of wrong speech.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.6_0: Those monks who have committed a serious offense, but then they should approach the Sangha and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.7_0: ‘The mendicant who has committed an offense should deal with it properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.8_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.21.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk has committed an offense entailing confession,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.21.4_0: It is an offense of wrong speech.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.21.5_0: Some monks regard it as an offense of wrong speech, but others as an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.21.6_0: Those monks who have wrong speech after getting them to be dealt with them according to the rule. They should then approach the Sangha and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.21.7_0: ‘The mendicant who has committed an offense should deal with it properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.21.8_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.1_0: It may happen on the invitation day that a monk has committed an offense of wrong speech.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.2_0: Some monks regard it as an offense of wrong speech, but others as a serious offense ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.3_0: Some monks regard it as an offense of wrong speech, but others as an offense entailing confession ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.4_0: Some monks regard it as an offense of wrong speech, but others as an offense entailing acknowledgment ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.5_0: Some monks regard it as an offense of wrong speech, but others as an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.6_0: Those monks who have wrong speech after getting them to be dealt with them according to the rule. They should then approach the Sangha and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.7_0: ‘The mendicant who has committed an offense should deal with it properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.8_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.0_0: Setting aside of an offense, etc.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day in the midst of the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.2_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.3_0: I know about an offense, but not who the offender is.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.4_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should set aside the offense and then do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.5_0: You should say this to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.6_0: ‘The Buddha has laid down a rule that the invitation procedure is for monks who are pure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.7_0: If you know the offense, but not the offender, then say now who it is that you suspect.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day in the midst of the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.2_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.3_0: I know of an offender, but not what the offense is.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.4_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should do the invitation procedure without the offender.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.5_0: You should say this to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.6_0: ‘The Buddha has laid down a rule that the invitation procedure should be done in a complete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.7_0: If you know the offender, but not the offense, then say now what it is that you suspect.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day in the midst of the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.2_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.3_0: I know an offender and his offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.4_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should set aside the offense and then do the invitation procedure without the offender.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.5_0: You should say this to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.6_0: ‘The Buddha has laid down a rule that the invitation procedure should be done in a complete assembly by monks who are pure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.7_0: If you know an offender and his offense, then say now who and what it is.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.26.1_0: “If the offense is known about before the invitation procedure, but the offender only afterwards, the offender should be corrected.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.26.2_0: If the offender is known about before the invitation procedure, but the offense only afterwards, the offender should be corrected.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.26.3_0: If both the offense and the offender are known about before the invitation procedure, and someone reopens the case after the invitation procedure has been done, he commits an offense entailing confession for the reopening.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.1_0: At that time in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country a number of monks who were friends had entered rainy-season residence together.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.2_0: Other monks who were quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha had entered the rains residence nearby. These monks said to one another,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.3_0: “At the invitation procedure, when those monks have completed the rains residence, we’ll cancel their invitation.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.4_0: The monks who were friends heard about this
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.6_0: ‘At the invitation procedure, when those monks have completed the rains residence, we’ll cancel their invitation.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.7_0: So what should we do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.8_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.1_0: “When monks entering the rainy-season residence in a certain monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.2_0: Other monks who were quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha had entered the rains residence nearby. These monks said to one another,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.3_0: ‘At the invitation procedure, when those monks have completed the rains residence, we’ll cancel their invitation.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.4_0: I allow those monks to do two or three observance-day ceremonies on the fourteenth
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.5_0: with the aim of having their invitation procedure before the other monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.6_0: “If those quarrelsome and argumentative monks are on their way to the other monastery, the resident monks should gather quickly and do the invitation procedure. When it has been done, they should say to the other monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.8_0: Or they do what they think is appropriate.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.3.1_0: If those quarrelsome and argumentative monks arrive without prior notice, the resident monks should prepare seats and set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. They should then go out to meet those monks, receive their bowl and robe, and ask if they want water to drink.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.3.2_0: Then, having distracted them, they should go outside the monastic boundary and do the invitation procedure there. When it has been done, they should say to the other monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.3.4_0: Or they do what they think is appropriate.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.1_0: If the other goes, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.2_0: If not, then a resident monk who is competent and capable should inform the resident monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.3_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the resident monks to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.4_0: If it seems appropriate to the venerables, we will now do the observance-day procedure by reciting the Monastic Code, and we will do the invitation procedure at the next new moon.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.5_0: “If those quarrelsome and argumentative monks are on their way to the other monks, the monks should say to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.6_0: ‘It would be good if you would do the invitation procedure with us now,’ they should be told,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.7_0: ‘You have no authority over our invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.8_0: We won’t do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.5.1_0: If the quarrelsome and argumentative monks stay on until the new moon, then a resident monk who is competent and capable should inform the resident monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.5.2_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the resident monks to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.5.3_0: If it seems appropriate to the venerables, we will now do the observance-day procedure by reciting the Monastic Code, and we will do the invitation procedure at the next full moon.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.5.4_0: “If those quarrelsome and argumentative monks are on their way to the other monks, the monks should say to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.5.5_0: ‘It would be good if you would do the invitation procedure with us now,’ they should be told,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.5.6_0: ‘You have no authority over our invitation procedure. We won’t do the procedure for the time being.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.6.1_0: If the quarrelsome and argumentative monks stay on even until the next full moon, then all the monks have no choice but to do the invitation procedure on the day of Komudī, the fourth full moon of the rainy season.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.7.1_0: “If, while you’re doing the invitation procedure, a sick monk cancels the invitation of a healthy monk, you should tell him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.7.3_0: An sick monk and awakened One
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.7.5_0: If you then wish, you may accuse him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.7.6_0: If he is corrected concerning that, and he then accuses her, he commits an offense entailing confession.
